projectDesc.p: The project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_idListMembers_v01.xml file.

div.p:
|| : || svasti śaka-varṣātīta 794 māgha-māsa dvādaśĭ śukla-pakṣa, mavulu Umanis· budhavāra, tatkāla rakarayan· I sirikan·
pu rakap·, dinmakan· dai śrī mahārāja rakai kayu vaṅi rikanaṁ sukat· kahulunan· Iṁ tunahan·, lmaḥ I mamali, maṅasəAkan· ra
karayān· pasamvaḥ I śrī mahārāja, mas· cumvi su 5 vḍihan· buAt· pinilai yu 2 gañjarpatra kban· 1 Ivak· jamvaṅan· 2 vuru-vuru va
raṅka 1 kamvaṁ vakul· 1 Anuṁ kinon· rakarayān· UmaṁsəAkna Ikanaṁ pasamvaḥ I śrī mahārāja, saṁ pamgat· tira pu bhujaṅga AsəAnya Iṁ
pahayu, lima vṅinikanaṁ pasamvaḥ Ann asə:, tinurus· Ikanaṁ lmaḥ dainiṁ rāma I mamali Inadagan dai saṁ hanuṁnaṁ pu śaṅkhara, ṅarannikanaṁ rāma
Anuṁ maturus· kalaṁ si kais·, gusti 2 ramani saṅkān·, ramani maṅarani, vinkas· ramani tan· livū, maṅatag· si Uṅgahan·, parujar· 2 si
vāhu, si golo, hulair· ramani Amvarī· hulair· karamān· ramani dravya·, mapkan· si kahuripan·, makajar· si balī, tuhālas· si valā, vinai
han· saṁ hanuṁnaṁ pirak· mā 10 pamlyanikanaṁ rāma vayū, muAṁ mas· mā 2 pamlyani vadvāḍmit· saṁ hanuṁnaṁ vayū, muvaḥ vinaihan· Ikanaṁ rāma I mama
li pirak· dhā 1 Avitan· 1 saṁ tuha kalaṁ si pundaṅil· vinaihan· vḍihan· yu 1

Hail! Elapsed Śaka year 794, month of Māgha, twelfth (tithi) of the waxing fortnight, Mavulu, Umanis, Wednesday. That was the time when the rakarayān of Sirikan, (named) pu Rakap, was bestowed by the Great King rakai Kayuvaṅi with the serfdom wasteland (sukat kahulunan) (called) Tunahan, a tract (ləmah) at Mamali.

The rakarayān offered as gifts to the Great King: 5 guilders (suvarṇa) of gold in grain (cumvi), 2 sets of vḍihan of pinilai manufacture, 1 kǝban of gañjarpatra, 2 pots of fish, 1 cage of wild pigeons, 1 basket of flowers.

The one who was ordered by the rakarayān to offer the gifts to the Great King was the officiant of Tira (called) pu Bhujaṅga. What he offered (asǝan-nya) was for the pahayu (?). Five nights did the gifts last, as he offered them.

The tract was provided with a fence by the elders of Mamali, attended by the hanuṅnaṅ (named) pu Śaṅkhara. Names of the elders who provided (it) with a fence: the kalaṅ Kais; 2 gustis, the father of Saṅkān [and] the father of Maṅarani; the vinǝkas, father of Tan Livū; the maṅatag (called) Uṅgahan; the 2 parujars (called) Vāhu [and] Golo; the hulair, father of Amvarī; the hulair of the village-community, father of Dravya; the mapǝkan (called) Kahuripan; the makajar (called) Bali; the tuhālas (called) Valā.

The hanuṅnaṅ was given 10 māṣas with which to buy (paməlyan) the elders of Vayū, and 2 māṣas of gold with which to buy the humble followers of the hanuṅnaṅ of Vayū. Also, the elders of Mamali were given 1 dhāraṇa of silver (and) 1 avitan; the foreman (saṅ tuha) of the kalaṅs (called) Pundaṅil was given one set of vḍihan.
